How to Install yubikey-val on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • yubikey-val

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install yubikey-val on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing yubikey-val on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall yubikey-val in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install yubikey-val, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install yubikey-val Using apt

To install yubikey-val in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install yubikey-val using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install yubikey-val

The installation of yubikey-val might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install yubikey-val Using apt-get

To install yubikey-val using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install yubikey-val.

sudo apt-get -y install yubikey-val

Install yubikey-val Using Synaptic

To install yubikey-val using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install yubikey-val on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for yubikey-val. This will display the yubikey-val package in the package window, now to install yubikey-val, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the yubikey-val package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of yubikey-val.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install yubikey-val Using aptitude

To install yubikey-val on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of yubikey-val.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install yubikey-val using the command aptitude install yubikey-val.

sudo aptitude -y install yubikey-val

How to Upgrade yubikey-val on debian

If you want to upgrade the yubikey-val package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade yubikey-val using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade yubikey-val to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade yubikey-val.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade yubikey-val sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade yubikey-val

Upgrade yubikey-val using Aptitude

To upgrade yubikey-val using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade yubikey-val.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade yubikey-val

Upgrade yubikey-val using Synaptic

To upgrade yubikey-val using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for yubikey-val, now right-click yubikey-val, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade yubikey-val just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall yubikey-val on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall yubikey-val from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just yubikey-val, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove yubikey-val

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of yubikey-val

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of yubikey-val you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge yubikey-val

Remove yubikey-val using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall yubikey-val using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for yubikey-val, right-click the yubikey-val package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall yubikey-val click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install yubikey-val on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade yubikey-val using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of yubikey-val then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
